authors.name: Stuart Hall
authors.pictures: Stuart Hall at desk, Stuart Hall standing

works.description: Capécia, Mayotte, 1948, Je suis Martiniquaise, Paris: Corrêa. Translated as I Am a Martinican Woman in I Am a Martinican Woman/The White Negress: Two Novelettes, Beatrice Stith Clark (trans.), Pueblo, CO: Passeggiata Press, 1997.
‘The New Conservatism and the Old’, Universities & Left Review, vol. 1, no. 1 (Spring 1957), 21–4.

legacy.title: Renate Zahar, Frantz Fanon: Colonialism and Alienation (1969, trans. 1974, Monthly Review Press)
David Caute, Frantz Fanon (1970, London: Wm. Collins and Co.)
In Conversation with Stuart Hall: C.L.R. James

events.author: Frantz Fanon
events.title: Resistance
events.description: Fled Martinique as a dissident and tried to enlist in the Free French Forces in Dominica

events.author: Frantz Fanon
events.title: Wounded in Colmar
events.description: Wounded in Colmar, France, received Croix de guerre. Fanon and fellow Afro-Caribbean soldiers were sent to Toulon (Provence) , and after that to Normandy to await repatriation.

events.author: Frant Fanon
events.title: Return to Campaign
events.description: Returned to Martinique, and worked for the parliamentary campaign of his friend and mentor Aimé Césaire and completed his baccalaureate.

events.author: Frant Fanon
events.title: Study in France
events.description: After this he left to France to study medicine and psychiatry in Lyon until 1950. Wrote three plays during these years.

events.author: Stuart Hall
events.description: One of the founders and editor of Universities and Left Review 1957-1959

pictures.name: Frantz Fanon at press conference

pictures.description: Frantz Fanon at a press conference of writers in Tunis, 1959.
